website_summaries.verdict: Plagued by issues, the Linksys EA6900 Smart WiFi Wireless AC Router AC1900 is only as good as a single-band router and hence not worth its premium price.
pros: The  Linksys EA6900 Smart WiFi Wireless AC Router AC1900 sports powerful hardware to offer superfast Wi-Fi speed at close range
The router boasts a compact and practical design
cons: The Linksys EA6900 has a long list of issues, including an unstable 5GHz band, a nonworking USB 3.0 port, a glitchy Linksys Smart Wi-Fi cloud-based feature, and overheating
Its performance over longer range is also not as good as similarly configured routers, and there are no new features

customer_reviews.title: Very bad, I litterally have to restart it twice a ...
customer_reviews.text: Very bad, I litterally have to restart it twice a day. If I don't, the internet is either really slow, or it just dosent pull up any website exept for youtube. I am only writing this review right now, because I am in the middle of playing csgo, and the stupid router lets me play the game, but when I try to open up steam, or try to use a browser, it is just utter s***.
customer_reviews.author: Andressa

customer_reviews.title: At first I thought it was our smart phones and other smart devices (tvs
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought it was our smart phones and other smart devices (tvs, tablets, roku, fire sticks). Then I realized that all the devices ran slow, didn't connect, or stay connected. The last router we had was a lot smaller and ran the devices better. For the money paid, I'm extremely disappointed with speed, connection, and overall processor. I do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Talitha Calamia

customer_reviews.title: I won't be buying this specific model again.
customer_reviews.text: Well, it worked good while it lasted. I had a few issues with it but the most recent, one of the ports went out on the device rendering it useless. I first started noticing bandwidth speeds on my network were about 10MB down when it was supposed to be 75 MB. Internet connection would randomly drop. Then finally went out altogether. I'm using my old linksys E2200 now. I'll still stick to Linksys products only because I am a fan of Cisco's products and they have great technical support but I would pass on this model.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Walker

customer_reviews.title: Linksys support non  existent.
customer_reviews.text: I had to wait to have someone install this router for me. we tried on 9/1 and ran into problems. called the tech support number and was told we called one day after 30 day warranty expired. I am furious. I am not paying them another cent. this installation has disconnected my kindle and ipad from my internet server and I can't figure out what to do. Amazon kindle help was not there at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Good router at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a relatively high-quality router at a reduced price. It has been working well in our tests. In fact, the Wi-Fi speed (throughput) of this router is higher than many others I have tested. So far the connections have been stable, and the user interface has been fairly high-quality and easy to configure (subtracted 1-star here due to some UI drop-outs during initial configuration). External interface security tests have been solid, as expected. This router has a Wi-Fi guest interface that has also been working well (and fast) during our tests. I would recommend this router for home users and Soho users.
customer_reviews.author: G. Tassone

customer_reviews.title: This is not the router you are looking for
customer_reviews.text: Thought I was getting a good Linksys product that was more of a professional grade. I was very disappointed in both the interface to the router and to the troubleshooting pages that were not there. The speed of this router is not that great and setup has been problematic. I have had to do a factory reset a few times. Will not buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Piewacket

customer_reviews.title: Worthless device
customer_reviews.text: Total CRAP Bought this to replace an old router I had to get something that was dual band so I could get 5Ghz wifi. It gives me that, but it drops it connection to the internet. I put it away when I moved and got a different ISP, pulled it out to play with, but it does the same thing with the new ISP, so it is an issue with the router itself dropping the connection.
customer_reviews.author: Doug W

customer_reviews.title: Very easy setup. This is my 3rd linksys router and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup. This is my 3rd linksys router and I am loyal to their brand because of the ease of setup and quality. I also appreciate the smartphone app and the ability to see my devices there as well as prioritize which is getting the signal. I have approximately 8 devices connected and speed in all of them is great. I pay for 50mbps of speed from my provider. Speed test shows 55mbps in main living area (router is not located there) and 50 in room farthest from router. Very very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Karen McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: firmware update eliminated key function I was depending on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router because of the detachable antennas. It was one of the only ones I could find that support dd-wrt and I could use an external antenna. Linksys was open source friendly and I confirmed others had it working on this model before I ordered it. Was surprised to find they changed the firmware to prevent compatibility with any of the open source projects. No longer allows the upload of non-linksys firmware, and the built in firmware only allowed it to act as an access point.
customer_reviews.author: Pete K

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought the AC1900 when my old NetGear router bit the dust. I thought it wasn’t putting out the single it should, or my old router did, After several hours on the phone with their tech support, a few hours with my cable provider, a service call from my cable provider and a new modem not much of an improvement. So, I bought this thinking maybe something was wrong with the router. Didn’t notice much of a difference. On the plus side both were very easy to setup and I really like the Smart WiFi app.
customer_reviews.author: David Hearn

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price, handles 9 devices without an issue.  Has mounting screw holes!
customer_reviews.text: No issues, great coverage, decent options for a consumer level device. I use the MAC filtering system for allowing devices so there is no encryption on the Wi-Fi and love it. The app for android provided by Linksys works okay, but it would be nice if you could access it via a mobile browser too, but it works fine, and is easy to use. Many routers have oddball issues with my providers Charter cable modem DHCP but this one handles it perfectly, no complaints. Many units don't come with mounting screw holes anymore, thank you for including them in this one.
customer_reviews.author: northofnowhere

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and very fast
customer_reviews.text: Works Great and very fast. One down side that i found is during set up I kept getting disconnected from the internet. But come to find out the issue was being caused my the Google Chrome browser i was using at the time. Switched over to Internet explorer for set up and then Firefox after that and have had no issues since and going on 2 months now. Have had the xbox one, computer broadcasting to a smart tv, 2 phones, and streaming Netflix all at the same time with no signs of lag
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Increased my wireless speeds by 100MB!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older router on the 2.4 ghz network that just wasn't giving me the wireless speeds I should be seeing from my 150MB internet package. I was getting about 35MB down on wireless, but after purchasing this router, that number jumped to 135MB using the 5ghz network and using a new Wireless AC wifi adapter. A full 100MB increase. This router is somewhat wider than your average routers, so space may be something to look at. I have noticed that this router does affect the wirelss baby monitors we have in our house, so that might be a deal breaker for some. Overall, I'm pretty happy with the speeds I'm getting with this router.
customer_reviews.author: Waylon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Solid and functional for the price.
customer_reviews.text: A solid, functional router with very adequate range. This router replaced a dead ASUS router and I must say I’m disappointed in the online control interface. It’s functional, and intuitive, but it doesn’t give you the deep network insight you can get from the ASUS control interface. I’m aware you can buy LINKSYS’ more expensive and open-source routers with more functionality but ASUS has that even with the lower-end models. Hope this changes as I plan to have this for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: The router keeps rebooting.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router based on good reviews and overall good features. However, the router I received keeps rebooting out of nowhere. In trying to fix the issue, I have searched and searched for clues and fixes from Linksys to no avail including making small tweaks, to not being able to downgrade the firmware because the system won't allow it. I would stay away from this device if at all possible. In fact, I will switch to a different brand altogether. I just wish I could get a refund on this.
customer_reviews.author: Gunner

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My ISP installed a low-end Cable Modem router that had very poor WiFi, so I purchased this device, configuration was relatively easy, Wi-Fi was awesome, but somehow, it started to fail after a while (I purchased it brand-new less than a year ago), even though the computers were able to connect through WiFi, they can't browse the web or communicate with any other device on the network, WiFi seems to be working (IP Address was assigned by DHCP), nothing works, computers are shown off-line, mobile phones work fine with this same configuration. Factory defaulted it, worked for a little bit then it stopped working properly again. Currently on the look for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Iveen Duarte

customer_reviews.title: Out of warranty after owning it for 2 months?
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for 2 months and it kept going out. Called tech support which after an HOUR got it to work... For a few hours. Then right back out. Tech support said it's out of warranty because it's been sitting in a warehouse for a year and the warranty goes off of that, not when you get it. I'll never buy another again. Serious buyer beware here folks.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Lasted 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: I used to trust Linksys routers, but not any more. This unit worked okay for about 2 months, then the router started working intermittently. Had to do a factory reset every other day just to get it running for a few hours. Finally gave up and dropped it off at electronics recycling, and it's probably sitting in a waste electronics mountain in China by now. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Lissa

customer_reviews.title: Great performance / features at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great router! I ordered this to upgrade to the faster protocols and the ease of setup was amazing! Additionally, the ability to set up guest access and soecify the bandwidth is a real plus. The iPhone / iPad app makes management a breeze! I was skeptical of the quality and features given the price but have been using this for a month or so and have been very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Parry

customer_reviews.title: Good router once it gets connected....
customer_reviews.text: Smart router would not connect! Customer service was quick to pick up. They couldn’t get it to connect either with verbal instructions (and I’m better than average with computers etc.) They wanted $20 to perform a remote connect thru my laptop. I refused so they said they would do it for $10 with a 14 day guarantee. I wasn’t happy but after trying for over 30 minutes I agreed to pay to get my smart router connected. Other than that the router has been good and the user interface is too!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Mazzullo

customer_reviews.title: Maybe look elesewhere
customer_reviews.text: Had this almost a year. Works great when it works. But a couple of times a month, it would disconnect and not work. It's frustrating but when I can afford a new router, doesn't even have to be split signals, I am replacing this one. Just not worth the frustration of signal loss when I am in the middle of something.
customer_reviews.author: F. Lee

customer_reviews.title: I have always liked how easy they are to set up and this ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had several linksys routers over the years. I have always liked how easy they are to set up and this was even easier than before. I enjoy being able to access my router from the mobile phone app or any computer with a new linksys account logon. I have not had any issues with the range of the router but i have a 100 sq ft home and the signal quality is good. Like anywhere there are dozens of other signals but they do not seem to interfere with mine. I got this for a little under 100.00 on sale and could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Richardson

customer_reviews.title: This looks to be remanufactured not new
customer_reviews.text: I received the (new) product in a brown box only. No advertisement/linksys naming or anything related, just a brown unmarked box. The product also doesn't have the same antenna's it shows online. The product works but now i have to make the decision, did i get ripped off paying new for remanu???
customer_reviews.author: t man

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: The provided instructions are not sufficient enough on how to get this to work. i had to try couple different ways to get it set up and get the signal from my modem. once i got this to work, i was able to receive wifi signals from the 1st floor even my router is on the 2nd floor.
customer_reviews.author: Bumble Bee

customer_reviews.title: Not as Advertised. Shame on Cisco and Belkin. Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Kind of misleading. It does not have the range at 5Ghz as you would expect. When I am more than 20 feet away from the router, I have a bad/weak signal. My old router worked better than this one. Not sure why they advertise this as a better wireless router that uses a 5Ghz frequency. Tech support was less than stellar. I was told to "turn the router off when not in use, otherwise it will over heat." This really makes me wonder about manufactures these days. I am writing this for the readers out there to warn them abut this router. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: 15 year Happy Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great while it lasted... just not long enough.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great, fast router, with an easy-to-use interface and features, however it lasted less than 6 months before the WAN port failed. Unless you know how to solder or hack into these routers, I would steer clear of this one. 6 months of use should not be enough to wear it out.
customer_reviews.author: Joey S.

customer_reviews.title: Mixed thoughts on this one
customer_reviews.text: This particular product works very well my only complaint is that in times the little antennas start falling over and there is nothing that you could do to bring them up on their own. I had to do it all over again I would’ve selected another links this model I probably will end up removing them other than that it works well
customer_reviews.author: Donna Benner

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Jan 2017 and the wireless began to cause the router to reboot incessantly for an indeterminate amount of time. This occurred Dec 2018. It was very frustrating to diagnose as I could get it to work for long periods of time. I didn't really have issues until now but I expect the durability to be longer than less than 2 years. Just bought a netgear....
customer_reviews.author: Darren Garner

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded for nothing
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice unit, I’m just disappointed that I replaced a 10 year old Netgear for a family member with this and the WiFi is zero improvement. Also, Guest setup would never work right, says password required but would let you join without one so don’t use it. Never bothered with tech support.
customer_reviews.author: campaholic

customer_reviews.title: Needs improved guest access
customer_reviews.text: Linksys product are great to use and set up. Documentation and on line help is outstanding. Need secure guest network When a user access the guest network they need a http page to complete the registration. The linksys http page is not secure. User cannot us guest network on item like a TV.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle 1

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box the Wifi did not work correctly
customer_reviews.text: I like the router, dual bands, guest band, app and controls. Previous one, same model, died after 4 years. Bought the same model again. Printers would not hook up to wifi, cell phones did. After two hours on the phone with Linksys Tech support after they reflashed and reset the router, they determined the channels on the wifi were not working correctly and it was defective. Will be asking Amazon for a replacement. Hope to have better luck with the next one.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: stronger than my other 2 routers combined...
customer_reviews.text: i have replaced 2 wifi routers with this one... I used to have 2 routers to cover my 2000 SQft house and the outside perimeter however with this one unit i can cover my entire house and about 30 feet radius around my house with ease.... it is great for streaming music and movies outside. great product and the directional antennas are awesome
customer_reviews.author: Holly Nelson

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have any of the problems some folks have mentioned setting this unit up. Everything is working as I had hoped. I have been fiddling with data Communications since 300 baud modems and before there were home routers. Maybe that makes things a little bit easier for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ghengis

customer_reviews.title: Good Price/Performance Ratio
customer_reviews.text: The cheapest AC1900 WiFi router I could find to replace my crappy Tenda WiFi router which was also AC1900 but very unreliable that failed to connect on a daily basis even with daily reboot! This router's UI is MUCH better than that of the Tenda and the Android app to access it is excellent. I've bought other routers including LinkSys but found this one to be stable and the best.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gadget

customer_reviews.title: Good router bad user interface
customer_reviews.text: Good router but user interface is something to desire. Not very intuitive, confusing and advanced features none existing. You have to follow stupid setup wizard to be able to go online. You can't just setup manually like more advanced users. Only reason I gave 4 stars because its reliable so far.
customer_reviews.author: Vm

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: So far. It works great. My 16yr old set it up 3 months ago in minutes. Our house is 2400sft.mainly on one level so the far ends of the house are a little iffy on the connection. But other then that all of the common areas get good signal and we have 4-7 devices connected at any given time. I like having the 2 network options. If one messes up I switch too the other. I have all my kids on one. So much better then our last router that had to be reset all of the time.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: great budget router
customer_reviews.text: I really like this router because of the wifi range and the price, but the setup is a likke tricky... I don't know why linksys does that weird software to setup the network, also it gives to the router a ramdon IP for configuration, it is almost impossible to setup thorugh a web browser, you need to download linksys app to get it work
customer_reviews.author: Vero

customer_reviews.title: CONTINUOUSLY DROPS CONNECTION, DO NOT BUY!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router with the hope of taking advantage of the higher speeds as we slowly add and upgrade our wireless devices. Right from the get go, I've had disconnection issues with my PC which is direct connected to the router (every 5-10 mins). I have double checked by directly connecting to modem which works fine. Based on some of the troubleshooting documents on the Linksys site, I've updated the firmware with no improvements. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: North of 30

customer_reviews.title: Don't use with a wireless Internet connection.
customer_reviews.text: Since I only have a wireless Internet connection, the Linksys router needed to be wired between the wireless Internet power brick and the Ethernet port on my PC. It functions as well as an unplugged cable. The Linksys AC1900 router DOES NOT WORK AT ALL.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Reliable, Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Reliable. Have 3 of these now and the oldest (version 1) is still working great. Decent WiFi. Good range, live in a 2 story. Good speed over WiFi Price. With the price drop this is an easy pick.
customer_reviews.author: DemonSVT

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t worth it’s price
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like it. It doesn’t work as wifi repeater like similar products from other companies like Tp-link It doesn’t worth this price. One of the antennas was cracked when arrive and Amazon asked me to ship it back if I want my money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ali Alamer

customer_reviews.title: I had an average speed service internet when using this but it was easy to set up and worked well
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. I had an average speed service internet when using this but it was easy to set up and worked well. It could be a 5 star unit but I didn't use it long enough to find out. Beats getting ripped off renting from an internet provider. Usually if you use it for a year to 2 year it pays for itself comparing it to renting. I loved the USB on the router that i could stream from to my TV streaming device.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Oneill

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a Good Router
customer_reviews.text: Had been using a really old model from linksys for awhile now and was really not getting the most out of my internet. What really bugged me was my old router would require restarts almost every hour or so at times. This new router fixed all of my problems. Perhaps every now and then I have to restart it but it really is bounds and leaps above the my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Dipo Lawal

customer_reviews.title: Lynksys prouct support is the worst I have ever experienced.
customer_reviews.text: This router's antennas will not stay upright. Signal strength is abysmal. Will not reach 30' . Customer service is sure you are stupid when you call and treat you that way. If they answer the phone. Usually take 5 minutes of just ringing. Then you are dealing with someone in India that you can't understand, who refuses to listen to the problem and wants to solve the problem they think they know how to fix. Asking for supervisory level support is always" they are in a meeting, I will help you" I will switch to Netgear as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Wood

customer_reviews.title: Low power
customer_reviews.text: The signal level was waay lower than the Buffalo WZR-1750 that was supposed to replace. I've tried installing DD-WRT on it, even with the TX power pushed to the max, the signal was still extremely weak.
customer_reviews.author: Sorin Toma

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've read many reviews for this model, as well as other Linksys routers, and many of the negative reviews all complained about the poor 2.4ghz band, they were right. This router gets us about .00 (ookla would not go any lower) to maybe 5 on good days, the one it replaced easily got 50-60. Terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Burdick

customer_reviews.title: Pricey Failure
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Linksys router (EA6900) as a part of upgrading the overall speed of my wireless network, and it worked great out of the box (minimal setup issues). Today and less than a month after purchase, it appears to have completely died in that it will not even pass the modem's hard-wired connection to my PC, much less any wireless signal. I have no idea what the root cause may have been, but it is dead. Fortunately I kept the old Linksys WRT160N and easily reinstalled it. Great router when it ran, but a 30-day lifespan for almost $200? Time to find another vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Old Guy

customer_reviews.title: Old Technology Still Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This is an old technology model that you can get at an economical price. I found the interface easy to set up. The external storage works with my Windows and my Linux computers. My house is not large, only about 1000 square feet, so my wifi coverage works throughout the house and out to by unattached garage.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan F

customer_reviews.title: i have never had a such a bad router. My internet doesn't work at all or ...
customer_reviews.text: This an awful product, i have never had a such a bad router. My internet doesn't work at all or crawls at 5mbps speed, or i have to reboot it 3 times a day. I have read some articles that settings can be adjusted, but this did not work for this router at all. Do not waste your time buying it or prepare yourself to an extreme aggravation or spend hours with useless support. This product should have never been released.
customer_reviews.author: JoannaORL

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Looked new. No lights, no activity. Didn't need to call tech support for a dead router. Reinstalled my old Linksys router and sent this one back. Good return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Hear That ?

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer support
customer_reviews.text: The device is defective only after 7 months. I have contacted Linksys and they have confirmed that the device is defective. They have forwarded me to contact the seller. The seller did not answer any of my questions at first. Then they decided to contact me but again nothing is solved. You should be aware of this while shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Can

customer_reviews.title: Linksys AC1900 Wi-Fi Wireless Dual-Band+ Router with Gigabit & USB 3.0
customer_reviews.text: My router was dying and I did the research on the new AC routers. This was exactly the one I wanted and it worked right out of the box. It was easy to set up and I had all of my settings and security up and running in about 10 minutes or less. You can't beat Lynksys for ease of start up and reliability. All of my games play nice with it, which was a big concern of mine. A definite increase in wireless speed and productivity. I have a 1 TB hard drive connected for network storage and all of my devices have access. It is well worth the money for the security and my piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Great router from a long time user
customer_reviews.text: Great router from a long time user. I bought this on June 22, 2014 and it's been solid for me. Very easy to set up and use. My primary machine relies heavily on 2.4ghz and I get great range when going outside or in the back yard.
customer_reviews.author: RotorBalls

customer_reviews.title: Not Sure yet
customer_reviews.text: Currently this is my 2nd unit in less then two months. Amazon has promptly replaced the first one due to drop signal issues. The 2nd one is doing the same thing and decided to contact Linksys support instead. I chose to use the free chat service and the guy guided me through some simple settings changes. I am hoping this resolves it. I have no complaints about their costumer service and will follow up with results of the setting changes. The features on the router are great and it looks good on paper but with the random drops its frustrating. I will give it 4 stars if my issues are fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Cato

customer_reviews.title: Amazing things do come at Great Prices!!!
customer_reviews.text: Simple and Easy and sends out an awesome signal for bigger homes. The standard cheap routers that I have used in the past, have never covered my whole house with a strong signal. This router does and I am pleased. It was simple and easy to set up and I love the fact that I can use my cell phone to access the router when I am not at home.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Duncan

customer_reviews.title: would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: started overheating and causing the WiFi to cut out and stop working while downloading or transferring large files did not do it at first but started a year or so after owning it
customer_reviews.author: Lee Yuen

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. Has better range then our old one. Easy setup, so easy even a caveman can..... nah just keep it at easy. Its even a tad bit faster then our old linksys.
customer_reviews.author: Ice-Child

customer_reviews.title: Not dependable
customer_reviews.text: The router doesn't work well. The usb ports suddenly stop and must be restarted The wireless signal is the same, requiring a restart Range is nothing to brag about either. You will find better Wireless range on the market, that preforms stronger too! If you have the money for this one you can afford one of the highest preforming routers on the market. You are BETTER served if you go else where. And if this review is not enough go check out Cnet's review of it..... I wish I did
customer_reviews.author: Bassamu

customer_reviews.title: Plugs and plays.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty straight forward install. Didn't have to do a whole lot of playing around configurations to set it up. Would buy again, but hopefully not too soon.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: if your not an electronic engineer beware.it's not a plug and play thing..
customer_reviews.text: The installation is way to complicated..I bought plenty of routers this one as to the most difficult to install..Never again I will buy a Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: leo54ca

customer_reviews.title: Awesome router
customer_reviews.text: I love having the USB ports on the router. I wish both of them were USB 3.0 instead of a 3.0 and a 2.0. I also wish it had the capability and the smarts to copy data from one external drive connected to one of the USB ports to another external drive connected to the other USB port. It was easy to setup and I love that you can access the external drive connected to the USB port from anywhere via the internet.
customer_reviews.author: R. Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Very strong signal
customer_reviews.text: This is the third wireless router I've tried. I have between 10 to 15 iPads smart phones ect on at once, the first routers I had kept dropping signal and just would not keep up with all the devices. This router is great it sends a strong signal were I used to get 2 bars with my old routers I get 4 with this one. My old routers used to make my internet slow this one makes my internet lightning fast. Really simple to set up. The only regret is I did not get this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Broken within a year
customer_reviews.text: I paid the top price and hope for the better performance. I was disappointed when the router start having problem 3 months after we used it. I often needed to unplug and reset it. The need to resetting it increase from weekly to every other day within 6 months and finally died less than a year. The range isn't signals is not any stronger than the older product. At the beginning, I thought the product was too new but the updated firmware wasn't able to fix the problem. I replaced it with a Linksys EA 6500, it is cheaper and I have used it for 6 months without much problem
customer_reviews.author: H. Chou

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a great router to install DDWRT on this is it
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a great router to install DDWRT on this is it. I updated the bootloader and installed DD-WRT and I am very happy with the results. There is a known issue with the default Linksys bootloader, if you are going to install DD-WRT be sure to search the web and learn about the 32k bootloader problem.
customer_reviews.author: RogueGeek

customer_reviews.title: So your wi-fi is out....how to setup? Download the phone App.
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent product but unless I missed something they assumed your online once you plug in? Anyway down load the link-sys smart control App and it will walk you thru setup in a about 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Tony

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: i got a broken device it doesnt work at all
customer_reviews.author: Heba atef

customer_reviews.title: Linksys AC1900 wireless switch
customer_reviews.text: Great product, extended my Wifi further than the one I received from my carrier. Is also much faster. This came amazingly fast, from Abes of Maine through Amazon. I live in WA state so to get this in 2 days was a great surprise
customer_reviews.author: Schmo Did

customer_reviews.title: Keeps DROPPING the signal
customer_reviews.text: Hi: I have been a Linksys customer for a while. Thought this router would replace my previous one with a faster signal - what with the external antennas and all. The signal is a bit stronger but the router keeps dropping the signal. I have to reboot it about once a day or so. My security camera is tied into this router - which really sucks for me. Forget about watching Netflix or itunes programs. No new firmware upgrades to see if that would help.
customer_reviews.author: J~

customer_reviews.title: This router has given me significant issues of the the ...
customer_reviews.text: This router has given me significant issues of the the past year that I've owned it. Every time the power goes out, you must perform a hard reset and enter all new settings to get it back up and running. This has happened 3 times in the last 12 months and Linksys will not stand behind an obviously defective product. I've owned 5 different Linksys routers over the past 10 years and none have exhibited this issue. As a long time, extremely loyal customer, I'll be doing business with another company in the future, Linksys (Belkin) does not stand behind their products
customer_reviews.author: RPF

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect to get a full gig from this device
customer_reviews.text: This device worked fine for well over a year. As soon as I installed gig fiber at my home, it would only push 1/10th of the speed. Directly connected I would get over a gig. I have looked at every setting known to man, and eventually just set up a PFSense box to replace this junk. Will not buy another Linksys product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: i have had linksys routers for 10 years. This one is the worst. Support is even terrible. I do not recommend buying this device. intermittent drops, weak signal. We spent 2 hours on the phone to fix with no luck. I travel and use cameras to check my home. it never works right. looking at asus rtac68u now. no more Linksys for me. What happened to customer Sat. Box is less than 4 months old and no return policy. Bad..Bad..Bad..Shame on Linksys!
customer_reviews.author: Securemonk

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install, Great Results
customer_reviews.text: If you’re anything like me, you dread updating technology. A family friend recommended this brand after having bad luck with the typical routers you can buy at large department stores. I’m so glad that we got this one! It was very easy to set up. We have never had a problem since and have several cell phones, laptops, and tablets connected. Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Maegan Collins

customer_reviews.title: A plug and play router this is not
customer_reviews.text: 20yrs in networking and i've worked with all levels of telco, enterprise and customer premise routers. I bought this to replace an ISP lease router. Get 150 with the ISP router, connect this router and get 40 Mbps. Search the internet and dozens of people with the same issue. The solution is to optimize it to your provider speeds and maybe it will provide the speeds it's advertised to support. Wrong answer. Returned for a TP-Link which pegged 150Mbps immediately with no tweaking.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Arrived before time and set up was easy
customer_reviews.text: I loved that it arrived BEFORE time. Setting up was pretty easy and the app was easy and pretty used friendly. So far it is good.
customer_reviews.author: AMA LALA

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: seems to work fine after a week update: not very good for long term usage its version 1.1 so maybe 2.0 would be better update 2: returned for a refund
customer_reviews.author: Scott Mccay

customer_reviews.title: Parental controls have multiple disabling issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the parental controls. I wish I had looked through the linksys online tech support threads first. There are a number of issues that make it malfunction and the (usually temporary) solutions are provided by other consumers. What has worked one time has failed the next. It’s frustratingly close to being a good system because the small amounts of time it works are very helpful. I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel L. Hatchimonji

customer_reviews.title: Garbage packaged as Something Pretty
customer_reviews.text: Never again. Broke after 18 months (refused to connect to internet). It appears that the adapter shorted out the input ethernet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frequently needs to be rebooted and parent controls don't work at all.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the parent controls. They don't work at all. On top of that, the wifi keeps going out and I have to reboot almost daily. Customer support seems non existent. Complete waste of money. Will never buy Linksys products again.
customer_reviews.author: P.Schmid

customer_reviews.title: loutsy Router
customer_reviews.text: signal is very poor to compare with my old Model Netgear. i keep in drawer and still use the Old Netgear. do not buy this product. i spent money for nonsense.
customer_reviews.author: Nou Nang

customer_reviews.title: Great router, great signal strength.
customer_reviews.text: Simple set up. Great signal strength throughout the house on 2.4ghz. Not running 5ghz at the moment due to lack of devices. 3600 sq foot 2 level house with minimum of 4 bar signal strength farthest from the router. It does get a bit warm on the bottom, propping it up for some air flow doesn't hurt. I used a few of the furniture pads for wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best AC router in the market.
customer_reviews.text: I had the Linksys AC1750 and it worked great for a year. Then it started acting up where the wifi would quit and I would have continuously reboot it to get it to work again. I bought the AC1900 and it has been perfect. I would totally recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: not as good as you would think
customer_reviews.text: not as good as you would think , you almost have to be an IT to set it up, this it a smart router, should be plug and play. Lots of signal loss to hub. poor support, Linksys has some great stuff, THIS IS NOT ONE OF THEM. Do your home work before you buy, you'll see what I'm taking about. check the specs, make up your own mind.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: Installation instructions were poor and once you actually do install it it was so simple makes you wonder why they couldn't explain it so easily in the instructions. Day one of use speed was excellent across all of our wireless devices including 4 gaming systems, three computers, two tablets and 4 phones and 5 smart tv's. By week three a noticeable drop off in speed. My biggest gripe is the range is poor which contradicts a claim that it had very good range. I'm disappointed in this purchase and wish I had chosen something different.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Bortz

customer_reviews.title: had many issues with the Linksys
customer_reviews.text: Kept having signal dropping issues. Returned and bought Netgear R7000. Totally love the Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: John Ortakales

customer_reviews.title: This router is not working for me. I am ...
customer_reviews.text: This router is not working for me. I am out of the return period as I have not had time to troubleshoot it until now. The router puts out a very low speed when doing a speed test on the router itself and drops signal on wireless devices periodically. I should have listened to other reviews. I have not spoken to Linksys tech support yet. My ISP offered me wireless connections through my cable modem at home so I am going that route rather that hassle with Linksys. But I now have a very expensive router that I can't use. :(
customer_reviews.author: Alaine Aipoalani

customer_reviews.title: wifi coverage sucks
customer_reviews.text: The older Linksys wifi routers were able to cover my whole house. This one only covers half my house.
customer_reviews.author: ZtraderX

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Replaced old router in a condo. It is very reliable and hooks up with the thermostate, etc.
customer_reviews.author: John in Alex

customer_reviews.title: Easy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. Replaced an old Linksys router by installing this one with exact same name and password and all my 20+ devices hooked up like they were still looking at the old router. Made the whole setup incredibly easy in my case.
customer_reviews.author: Marty J.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Little over 4 years and started to overheat and made me loose connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: AHSGMA

customer_reviews.title: good medium to high end Unit.
customer_reviews.text: Unit worked as expected - I like the AC band/feature. Trouble with the Antennaes - they won't stay tight and they fall out of position. Unit is supposed to work with my Home Automation network - haven't yet tried that. The USB drive works excellently. Wireless 2.4 and 5 are customizable as I want. Can even overlay the SSID's. Guest network feature I don't use but exists.
customer_reviews.author: ShuMO

customer_reviews.title: Worthless Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Read all of the 1 star reviews. Today is May 16, 2014 and the problems still exist, and for me I've only had the unit a couple days. Requires nearly daily reboots to restore service for DHCP. 2.4Ghz band drops and requires reboot to restore. Utilizing external storage will lock up the unit. Junk. Complete crap. Very upset. Current version: 1.1.42.158863 with no updates found.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect router for our household
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect router for our household. We have multiple computers, multiple devices, and we are still running a baby monitor (which I just found out can affect the wifi in your house). The dual channels help and being able to give priority to certain devices is a plus as well. Very sleek and slim looking and a breeze to set up. The user interface is sleek and fairly user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa MullinsTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Internet signal
customer_reviews.text: Much better signal in the valley then the one ISP provided (and we had to rent)
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn K Boyuka

customer_reviews.title: Worst customer service of all time
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 5 months of use, tech support couldn't resolve my issues. Customer service for linksys has been a nightmare, I have been transferred back and fourth repeatedly placed on hold and then they hung up on me. They gave me their rebate number instead of the number I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: IT HAS PLENTY OF POWER AND WORKS FOR ME.
customer_reviews.text: IT IS NICE AND POWERFUL. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR SO IF YOU HAVE SEVERAL THINGS THAT CAN RUN WIRELESS IN YOUR HOME GET THE BEST ROUTER YOU CAN AFFORD TO BUY. TECH SUPPORT IS NICE BUT SOME OF THEM NEED MORE TRAINING IN SOME AREAS. I USE ROKU AND THE PROGRAMS DON'T STOP AND START AS MUCH AS THEY USED TO.
customer_reviews.author: Mona Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good performance for an easy price
customer_reviews.text: This unit did not pick up my wireless modem, but tech support walked me through it over the phone. I am pleased with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Cradduck

customer_reviews.title: Great range! My older router sent a weak signal ...
customer_reviews.text: Great range! My older router sent a weak signal to the other side of the house but no problems with this one. I do get fluctuations up and down with speed but it's my Internet not the router.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Lowmiller

customer_reviews.title: working great
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, we installed router about a month ago and everything's working fine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after a year
customer_reviews.text: This router was great when it worked but almost a year to the day since purchase, the Ethernet port went out so it is now nothing but a switch instead of a router and useless for WiFi. I would think a brand like Linysys would have better performance.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Jackson

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed. research on goole said this was one of ...
customer_reviews.text: wanted to upgrade, bought ac1900. no difference. wanted stronger signal through out home (less than 1000q ft) walk out of room that has ac1900 signal drops considerably. very disappointed. research on goole said this was one of the best for 2018. i thought this was a 2018 model, box date is 2013. also instructions terrible. should have stayed with old wi-fi and saved my money.
customer_reviews.author: thomas m. jones

product_meta.title: Linksys AC1900 Wi-Fi Wireless Dual-Band+ Router with Gigabit & USB 3.0 Ports, Smart Wi-Fi App Enabled to Control Your Network from Anywhere (EA6900)
product_meta.description: Perfect for HD video streaming, this dual band router delivers speeds of up to N600 + AC1300 Mbps. Four Gigabit Ethernet ports make it easy to share data quickly across your network and to external devices. You can use the high performance USB 3.0 port to attach a storage device and quickly transfer large files or share devices across your Wi Fi network. Plus, the USB 2.0 port is perfect for smaller file transfers or a dedicated printer. Beamforming focuses the Wi Fi signal directly to your smartphones, tablets and laptops instead of sending out a general transmission for a more efficient network with a wider range. Smart Wi Fi lets you access your network anytime, anywhere. Using your browser or the Smart Wi Fi mobile app, you can prioritize devices or websites, control content, monitor network activity and more. Advanced WPA2 encryption and SPI firewall help keep your network and personal information safe and secure.
feature_bullets: Up to N600 Mbps (2.4 GHz) + AC1300 Mbps (5.0 GHz) speeds with Simultaneous Dual Band
Platform Compatibility : Windows XP, Windows Vista 32/64, Windows 7 32/64, Windows 8 32/64, Mac 10.5.8 Leopard, Mac 10.6.1 Snow Leopard, Mac 10.7 Lion or later
Includes Linksys Smart Wi Fi providing easy CD free set up, remote network management, parental control and app enabled networking
1 USB 3.0 and 1 USB 2.0 port to print, share and store content. 3 adjustable external antennas provide maximum range
Beam forming technology follows your Tablet, Smartphone or Notebook to ensure a great connection as you move around your home. Please refer the User Manual before use
Dual Core 800Mhz CPU for lightning fast processing
4 gigabit ports to connect wired devices
DLNA certified for home media management

specifications.Operating System: Windows XP SP3, Windows Vista SP1 or later, Windows 7, Windows 8, Mac OS X Leopard 10.5.8 or later, Snow Leopard 10.6.1 or later, Lion 10.7 or later, Mountain Lion 10.8
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,355 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
